page.title: 15Life in Winston Today.(ctd).
page.content: Undobtedly this is a great success, for tennis is by far the most popular participant sport for Winston residents, with other sports far behind e.g. the jogging craze has only two adherents. Winston's major change in recent years has been a gradual one. Whilst a housing development, Highcliffe Edge, has appeared at the western end of the village, other buildings have changed their use or have been rebuilt to harmonize with their original design and that of the surrounding buildings. The Church Mews has been constructed into houses from barns; The "Bridgewater Arms", (the only public house) has been converted from the old village school. The original public house is now a dwelling house and the old post office is now a bungalow.
